comment.author: 41909278@N08
comment._content:
This was an attempt by Earl Bacon to improve the characteristics of, and perhaps extend the life of the T-6 aircraft. Registered as N66J, the aircraft has a close fitting cowl (the exhaust collector ring had been removed), a blown canopy, tricycle landing gear and Cessna type tip tanks.  The results were positive, but no production ensued.

Doug MacPhail
